docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Aug. 27 -- Rebel forces attempting to overthrow the Government were reported tonight to be holding one city in Bolivia's tin mining district and to be fighting at another.
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Aug. 27 -- Rebel forces attempting to overthrow the Government were reported tonight to be holding one city in Bolivia's tin mining district and to be fighting at another.
docs.abstract: Govt repts quelling Army-MNR revolt; rebels claim to hold Santa Cruz and to prevent Govt landings at Cochabamba; Cong extends state of seige; MNR leaders listed

headline.main: Bolivian Rebels Claim Santa Cruz; Reported Crushed in Two Cities; BOLIVIAN REBELS CLAIM SANTA CRUZ

docs.snippet: If it were not the subject of constant discussion in top economic and international banking and political quarters the redundancy of the devaluation of pound sterling as an item would be wearisome.

docs.snippet: The Nationalist blockade of Shanghai and the Hawaii dock strike have hurt Pacific shipping but some of the loss has been made up by increased business with the Philippines and Japan, Giles C. Stedman, vice president of the United States Lines Pacific...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nationalist blockade of Shanghai and the Hawaii dock strike have hurt Pacific shipping but some of the loss has been made up by increased business with the Philippines and Japan, Giles C. Stedman, vice president of the United States Lines Pacific services, said yesterday.
docs.abstract: Maritime Comm sets hearing on Moore-McCormack plea for operating subsidy

headline.main: Shipping News and Notes; Increased Maritime Trade With the Philippines and Japan Cuts Hawaii Strike Losses
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Sept. 2, 1949.

docs.snippet: A distinct tone of firmness was evident in the market for pound sterling last week as this was linked to the opening sessions of the tripartite Ministers' conference in Washington, which is canvassing the dollar crisis of Great Britain.
docs.lead_paragraph: A distinct tone of firmness was evident in the market for pound sterling last week as this was linked to the opening sessions of the tripartite Ministers' conference in Washington, which is canvassing the dollar crisis of Great Britain.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Sept. 16 -- The election of Brig. Gen. Carlos P. Romulo, the Philippine Ambassador to the United Nations, as President of the General Assembly became a strong probability today when Nasrollah Entezam, the Iranian representative,...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Sept. 16 -- The election of Brig. Gen. Carlos P. Romulo, the Philippine Ambassador to the United Nations, as President of the General Assembly became a strong probability today when Nasrollah Entezam, the Iranian representative, withdrew in his favor.
docs.abstract: N Entezam (Iran) withdraws from Pres contest; Brig Gen Romulo (Philippines) seen elected

headline.main: ROMULO SEEN HEAD OF U. N. ASSEMBLY; Entezam of Iran Withdraws -- Pearson Favored to Guide the Political Committee

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Trading in the pound sterling last week developed an "off-the-spot-and-back-again" routine when first the tripartite Ministers' conference passed blithely over any reference to devaluation which brought in its wake a robust advance in forwards, only...
docs.lead_paragraph: Trading in the pound sterling last week developed an "off-the-spot-and-back-again" routine when first the tripartite Ministers' conference passed blithely over any reference to devaluation which brought in its wake a robust advance in forwards, only to have this complacency shattered when the IMF and World Bank later reports revealed support of devaluation via a "realistic evaluation" of the pound.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Sept. 16, 1949.

docs.snippet: Declaring that this session of the United Nations General Assembly "coincides with a turning point in post-war international relations," Brig. Gen. Carlos P. Romulo, its newly elected President, yesterday called on the delegates from fifty-nine...
docs.lead_paragraph: Declaring that this session of the United Nations General Assembly "coincides with a turning point in post-war international relations," Brig. Gen. Carlos P. Romulo, its newly elected President, yesterday called on the delegates from fifty-nine countries to win for it the title of the "peace Assembly."
docs.abstract: Dr H Santa Cruz (Chile) elected chmn

headline.main: ROMULO IS ELECTED U.N. ASSEMBLY HEAD AT OPENING MEETING; Philippine Delegate Receives 53 Votes -- Russian Group Backs Czech Candidate

docs.snippet: Comparatively few cancellations by foreign buyers of orders for United States goods have developed thus far as a result of the wave of currency devaluation, exporters here reported yesterday.
